item.description:
You may start driving Aston Martins, knocking back vodka martinis or even painting yourself gold after indulging in the intoxicating double feature of Bond, James Bond at Cinestudio. We kick off with FROM RUSSIA WITH LOVE starring the dangerously debonair Sean Connery as the one true Bond. Communism and the still ginormous Soviet empire hasn?t a chance up against the ingenious gadgetry and sex appeal of a lone British agent who is licensed to kill. Next up is, with the all-time best opening song (at least until Amy Winehouse gets her act together). Sean Connery is back behind the wheel with co-stars Gert Frobe, Harold Sakata and his very nasty bowler hat, and Honor Blackman as, yes, Pussy Galore. To be fair, this time it?s a capitalist that?s spoiling for a fight, with a diabolical plot to radiate Fort Knox. Sophisticated, suspenseful and hip, it?s no surprise the original Bond films continue to spawn (mostly lesser) descendants, from Octopussy to The Bourne Supremacy to, well, Goldmember.


FROM RUSSIA WITH LOVE
GOLDFINGER
(1963,1964)
118 min, 94 min

Director: Terence Young. Screenplay by Richard Maibaum based on the novel by Ian Fleming. Cast: Sean Connery, Lotte Lenya, Robert Shaw, Bernard Lee and Lois Maxwell.
Director: Guy Hamilton. Screenplay by Richard Maibaum based on the novel by Ian Fleming. Cast: Sean Connery, Honor Blackman, Gert Fr√∂be, Harold Sakata, Bernard Lee and Lois Maxwell.

Note: if you haven't been to Cinestudio yet, give yourself some extra time. There's construction on the Trinity Campus so it's not as easy to get to theater. There's a file in the file section with directions. If you're having trouble, feel free to call me at 203-812-0705.

FYI, I may just be there for the first movie.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll meet you in the lobby. The movie starts at 7:30 but let's meet @7.
item.name: James Bond Double Header - From Russia with Love and Goldfinger
